description.zh-cn: 中国清朝晚期宗室、政治家、军事家、外交家和洋务派领袖。道光帝第六子，咸丰帝异母弟。在辛酉政变后与两宫太后共同执政，主导洋务运动，后在甲申易枢中被慈禧太后罢黜。
description.en: A prince, statesman, military leader, diplomat, and leader of the Self-Strengthening Movement in the late Qing dynasty of China. He was the sixth son of the Daoguang Emperor and the half-brother of the Xianfeng Emperor. He co-ruled with the two empress dowagers after the Xinyou Coup and led the Self-Strengthening Movement, but was later dismissed by Empress Dowager Cixi during the Jiashen Purge.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第八位皇帝，奕䜣与咸丰帝之父。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Qing dynasty, father of Yixin and the Xianfeng Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝皇贵妃，奕䜣的生母，咸丰帝的养母。
description.en: An Imperial Noble Consort of the Daoguang Emperor, the biological mother of Yixin, and the adoptive mother of the Xianfeng Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第九位皇帝，道光帝第四子，奕䜣的异母兄。
description.en: The ninth emperor of the Qing dynasty, the fourth son of the Daoguang Emperor, and the half-brother of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 咸丰帝的贵妃，同治帝的生母。晚清重要的政治人物，与奕䜣在辛酉政变中结盟，后又将其罢黜，独揽大权。
description.en: A noble consort of the Xianfeng Emperor and the biological mother of the Tongzhi Emperor. An important political figure in the late Qing Dynasty, she allied with Yixin in the Xinyou Coup but later dismissed him to consolidate her own power.

description.zh-cn: 咸丰帝的皇后。在辛酉政变后与慈禧、奕䜣共同执政，是奕䜣的重要政治盟友。
description.en: The empress of the Xianfeng Emperor. After the Xinyou Coup, she co-ruled with Cixi and Yixin, and was an important political ally of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 1861年由奕䜣与两宫皇太后发动的政变，推翻了咸丰帝遗命的顾命八大臣，确立了“垂帘听政”的权力格局。
description.en: A coup launched in 1861 by Yixin and the two empress dowagers, which overthrew the eight regent ministers appointed by the Xianfeng Emperor and established a power structure of 'ruling from behind the curtain'.

description.zh-cn: 咸丰帝临终前任命的八位辅佐同治帝的赞襄政务王大臣，以肃顺为首，在辛酉政变中被清除。
description.en: The eight ministers appointed by the Xianfeng Emperor on his deathbed to assist the young Tongzhi Emperor, led by Sushun. They were eliminated in the Xinyou Coup.

description.zh-cn: 晚清时期由奕䜣等官员主导的引进西方军事装备、机器生产和科学技术以自强的运动。
description.en: A movement in the late Qing Dynasty led by officials like Yixin to strengthen China by adopting Western military technology, machinery, and scientific knowledge.

description.zh-cn: 清朝晚期设立的中央级外交机构，由奕䜣倡导成立并长期主管。
description.en: A central-level foreign affairs office established in the late Qing Dynasty, founded and long managed under the advocacy of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 1884年（甲申年），慈禧太后借中法战争失利之机，罢免恭亲王奕䜣及其整个军机处班子的事件。
description.en: An event in 1884 (the Jiashen year) where Empress Dowager Cixi used the defeat in the Sino-French War as a pretext to dismiss Prince Gong Yixin and his entire Grand Council.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末清朝与法国之间因越南主权问题爆发的战争，清军的败退成为甲申易枢的导火索。
description.en: A war in the late 19th century between the Qing Dynasty and France over the sovereignty of Vietnam. The defeat of the Qing army became the trigger for the Jiashen Purge.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后心腹太监，因违反祖制私自出京，被奕䜣下令处死。
description.en: A trusted eunuch of Empress Dowager Cixi, he was executed on Yixin's orders for violating ancestral rules by leaving the capital without permission.

description.zh-cn: 清末重臣，光绪帝的老师。因反对洋务运动，在奕䜣临终前进言后被光绪帝罢黜。
description.en: A prominent minister in the late Qing Dynasty and the tutor of the Guangxu Emperor. He opposed the Self-Strengthening Movement and was dismissed by the Guangxu Emperor after Yixin's advice on his deathbed.

description.zh-cn: 由光绪帝和维新派推动的政治改革运动，遭到以慈禧太后为首的保守派和奕䜣等人的抵制。
description.en: A political reform movement promoted by the Guangxu Emperor and the reformists, which was resisted by conservatives led by Empress Dowager Cixi and others, including Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 英法联军发动的侵华战争，战后奕䜣负责议和并签订《北京条约》，其政治生涯也因此迎来转机。
description.en: A war of aggression against China launched by British and French forces. After the war, Yixin was responsible for peace negotiations and signing the 'Convention of Peking', which marked a turning point in his political career.

description.zh-cn: 清朝晚期的大规模农民起义，在奕䜣掌权期间被平定。
description.en: A large-scale peasant rebellion in the late Qing Dynasty, which was suppressed during the period when Yixin was in power.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第十位皇帝，咸丰帝独子。其“同治”年号意为两宫太后与奕䜣共同治理国家。
description.en: The tenth emperor of the Qing dynasty, the only son of the Xianfeng Emperor. His reign title 'Tongzhi' implied joint rule by the two empress dowagers and Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 清朝第十一位皇帝，由慈禧太后和奕䜣等人在同治帝死后拥立。
description.en: The eleventh emperor of the Qing dynasty, enthroned by Empress Dowager Cixi and Yixin after the death of the Tongzhi Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣的嫡福晋，大学士桂良之女。
description.en: The primary consort of Yixin, daughter of the Grand Secretary Guiliang.

description.zh-cn: 清朝重臣，奕䜣的岳父。
description.en: A high-ranking official of the Qing Dynasty and the father-in-law of Yixin.

en: Princess Rongshou of the First Rank

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣长女，慈禧太后养女。
description.en: The eldest daughter of Yixin and the adopted daughter of Empress Dowager Cixi.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣长子。
description.en: The eldest son of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣次子，溥伟、溥儒的生父。
description.en: The second son of Yixin, biological father of Puwei and Puru.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣长孙，载滢长子，过继给载澂。第二代恭亲王。
description.en: The eldest grandson of Yixin, biological son of Zaiying, and adopted son of Zaicheng. The second Prince Gong.

description.zh-cn: 清朝与日本之间为争夺朝鲜半岛控制权而爆发的战争。战时，赋闲的奕䜣被重新起用。
description.en: A war between the Qing dynasty and Japan over control of the Korean Peninsula. During the war, the retired Yixin was recalled to service.

description.zh-cn: 清代北京地区的行政区划名称。
description.en: The administrative name for the Beijing area during the Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝中后期的中央最高决策机构。
description.en: The supreme central decision-making body in the middle and late Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝在第二次鸦片战争后与英国、法国、俄国签订的一系列不平等条约。
description.en: A series of unequal treaties signed by the Qing Dynasty with Britain, France, and Russia after the Second Opium War.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣是道光帝（旻宁）的第六子。
description.en: Yixin was the sixth son of the Daoguang Emperor (Minning).

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣的生母是孝静成皇后。
description.en: Yixin's biological mother was Empress Xiaojingcheng.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣是咸丰帝（奕𬣞）的同父异母弟。
description.en: Yixin was the younger half-brother of the Xianfeng Emperor (Yizhu).

description.zh-cn: 瓜尔佳氏是奕䜣的元配（嫡福晋）。
description.en: Lady Gūwalgiya was the primary consort of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 瓜尔佳氏是大学士桂良之女。
description.en: Lady Gūwalgiya was the daughter of the Grand Secretary Guiliang.

description.zh-cn: 荣寿固伦公主是奕䜣的长女。
description.en: Princess Rongshou was the eldest daughter of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 载澂是奕䜣的长子。
description.en: Zaicheng was the eldest son of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 载滢是奕䜣的次子。
description.en: Zaiying was the second son of Yixin.

description.zh-cn: 溥伟是载滢的长子，后过继给载澂。
description.en: Puwei was the eldest son of Zaiying and was later adopted by Zaicheng.

description.zh-cn: 同治帝（载淳）是咸丰帝（奕𬣞）的独子。
description.en: The Tongzhi Emperor (Zaichun) was the only son of the Xianfeng Emperor (Yizhu).

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣出生于京师顺天府。
description.en: Yixin was born in Shuntian Prefecture, the capital.

description.zh-cn: 道光帝通过修建其母静贵妃的妃园寝，变相宣布奕䜣在皇位继承斗争中失败。
description.en: The Daoguang Emperor implicitly announced Yixin's failure in the succession struggle by ordering the construction of a tomb for his mother, Noble Consort Jing, within the consort mausoleum.

description.zh-cn: 1855年，咸丰帝以办理其母丧仪不周为由，免去了奕䜣的军机大臣等职务。
description.en: In 1855, the Xianfeng Emperor dismissed Yixin from his positions, including Grand Councilor, on the grounds of improper handling of his mother's funeral arrangements.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣联合两宫皇太后发动了辛酉政变，夺取了国家最高权力。
description.en: Yixin, in alliance with the two empress dowagers, launched the Xinyou Coup to seize supreme state power.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后联合奕䜣发动了辛酉政变，以实现垂帘听政。
description.en: Empress Dowager Cixi launched the Xinyou Coup in alliance with Yixin to establish her regency.

description.zh-cn: 辛酉政变推翻了咸丰帝遗命的顾命八大臣，并将其一网打尽。
description.en: The Xinyou Coup overthrew and eliminated the eight regent ministers appointed by the Xianfeng Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 辛酉政变后，奕䜣成为议政王，与两宫太后共同执政，掌握了军政大权。
description.en: After the Xinyou Coup, Yixin became the Prince Regent, co-ruling with the two empress dowagers and holding military and political power.

description.zh-cn: 在辛酉政变期间及其后初期，奕䜣与慈禧太后是政治盟友，共同执政。
description.en: During and immediately after the Xinyou Coup, Yixin and Empress Dowager Cixi were political allies, ruling together.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣与慈安太后是长期政治盟友，慈安的支持是奕䜣制衡慈禧的重要保障，直到其1881年去世。
description.en: Yixin and Empress Dowager Ci'an were long-term political allies. Ci'an's support was a crucial safeguard for Yixin against Cixi until her death in 1881.

description.zh-cn: 自1865年起，慈禧太后因忌惮奕䜣的权势而开始猜忌和打击他，最终在1884年将其罢黜。
description.en: Starting in 1865, Empress Dowager Cixi grew wary of Yixin's power and began to distrust and undermine him, eventually dismissing him in 1884.

description.zh-cn: 咸丰帝在第二次鸦片战争中北逃，任命奕䜣留守北京负责议和，这为奕䜣积累政治资本和国际声望创造了机会。
description.en: During the Second Opium War, the Xianfeng Emperor fled north and appointed Yixin to stay in Beijing for peace negotiations, which created an opportunity for Yixin to accumulate political capital and international prestige.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣作为钦差大臣，代表清朝与英、法、俄等国签订了《北京条约》。
description.en: As the imperial commissioner, Yixin represented the Qing dynasty in signing the 'Convention of Peking' with Britain, France, Russia, and other nations.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣主政期间，利用列强并支持曾国藩等人，最终平息了太平天国运动。
description.en: During his administration, Yixin utilized the foreign powers and supported figures like Zeng Guofan to finally suppress the Taiping Rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣建议并推动清廷成立了专管外交事务的总理各国事务衙门。
description.en: Yixin proposed and pushed for the Qing court to establish the Zongli Yamen, an office specializing in foreign affairs.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣长期担任总理衙门首席大臣。
description.en: Yixin served as the chief minister of the Zongli Yamen for a long period.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣是洋务运动的主要发起者及领袖，倡导并创办近代军事工业。
description.en: Yixin was the main initiator and leader of the Self-Strengthening Movement, advocating for and establishing modern military industries.

description.zh-cn: 1869年，奕䜣下令山东巡抚丁宝祯将违制出京的慈禧心腹太监安德海就地正法，由此深为慈禧所恨。
description.en: In 1869, Yixin ordered Shandong governor Ding Baozhen to execute Cixi's trusted eunuch An Dehai for illegally leaving the capital, thereby incurring Cixi's deep hatred.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后借中法战争失利之机发动甲申易枢，罢免奕䜣及其党羽。
description.en: Empress Dowager Cixi used the defeat in the Sino-French War as an opportunity to launch the Jiashen Purge, dismissing Yixin and his faction.

description.zh-cn: 在甲申易枢事件中，奕䜣被罢去一切职务，正式退出权力核心。
description.en: During the Jiashen Purge, Yixin was stripped of all his posts and formally withdrew from the core of power.

description.zh-cn: 1894年中日甲午战争爆发后，赋闲多年的奕䜣被慈禧太后重新起用。
description.en: After the outbreak of the First Sino-Japanese War in 1894, Yixin, who had been in retirement for many years, was recalled to service by Empress Dowager Cixi.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣晚年对光绪帝意图发动的维新变法运动极力抵制、屡加阻挠。
description.en: In his later years, Yixin strongly resisted and repeatedly obstructed the reform movement that the Guangxu Emperor intended to launch.

description.zh-cn: 奕䜣在病逝前向光绪帝表达对翁同龢的反对意见，促使光绪帝罢黜了翁同龢。
description.en: Before his death, Yixin expressed his opposition to Weng Tonghe to the Guangxu Emperor, which led the emperor to dismiss Weng.
